name: Charge
effect: Some particularly powerful Maneuvers require Charges. Charges are granted for a specific Maneuver, such as Earthen Aegis. Stances and Techniques grant a certain number of Charges when used. Charges are always lost at the end of the Round.

name: Defense
effect: Defenses are _Grit_, _Reflex_, and _Poise_. These are commonly spent to mitigate damage and avoid status effects.

name: Endurance
effect: A character has a pool of Endurance, representing their ability to fight and defend themselves. All characters have 30 Endurance. When a character takes damage they lose Endurance after losing Vigor, but before losing Health. When a character has no Endurance they are Winded, which causes them to add Glancing to all effects.

name: Guard
effect: A character with Guard reduces all Damage they receive by an amount equal to their Guard. A creature typically may not have more than 4 Guard.

name: Poise
effect:
Characters typically have a passive amount of Poise determined by their _Equipment_ and _Stances_. After being attacked, taking Damage, or gaining Status a creature may expend any amount of Poise for the following effects:
* X Poise: Negate an afflicted Status with the listed cost (for example, you may spend 2 Poise to Negate Break (2 Poise)).
* 1 Poise: If you take Damage with the [_Mental_] tag, reduce the Damage by 2. A creature may choose this option multiple times.
* 1 Poise: Reduce the Value of _Impaired_ or _Exposed_ inflicted by 1, starting with the smallest Token.

name: Grit
effect:
Characters typically have a passive amount of Grit determined by their _Equipment_ and _Stances_. After being attacked, taking Damage, or gaining Status a creature may expend any amount of Grit for the following effects:
* X Grit: Negate an afflicted Status with the listed cost (for example, you may spend 2 Grit to Negate Grappled (2 Grit)).
* 1 Grit: If you take Damage with the [_Poison_] tag, reduce the Damage by 2. A creature may choose this option multiple times.
* 1 Grit: Reduce a _Forced Movement_ effect by 1. A creature may choose this option multiple times.

name: Health
effect: A character has a pool of Health, representing their ability to take physical punishment. When a character takes damage they lose Health after losing Vigor and Endurance. When a character has no Health they are Defeated.

name: Momentum
effect: Momentum represents various advantages in combat. It is spent for a myriad of effects, but most commonly increasing the power of Actions and using Counter and Punish Maneuvers.

name: Reflex
effect:
Characters typically have a passive amount of Reflex determined by their _Equipment_ and _Stances_. After being attacked, taking Damage, or gaining Status a creature may expend any amount of Reflex for the following effects:
* X Reflex: Negate an afflicted Status with the listed cost (for example, you may spend 2 Reflex to Negate Grappled (2 Reflex)).
* 1 Reflex: If you take Damage with the [_Avoidable_] tag, reduce the Damage by 2. A creature may choose this option multiple times.
* 1 Reflex: Reduce the Value of _Bleed_ inflicted by 1, starting with the smallest Token.

name: Vigor
effect: A character has a pool of Vigor, representing their will to fight and inspiration. This pool begins at 0, and can typically only be gained in combat. Whenever a character gains Vigor the new value replaces their current Vigor if it is greater than their current Vigor. When a character takes damage they always lose Vigor first. A character takes no bonuses or penalties for not having Vigor.
